DataElement.preferredName: Agent Dose Modification Negation Hematologic Toxicity Reason Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._Change, alteration, or adjustment of a dose specified in a treatment plan or/and administered to a patient._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs._The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Agent Dose Modification Negation Hematologic Toxicity Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._Change, alteration, or adjustment of a dose specified in a treatment plan or/and administered to a patient._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs._The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.:Change, alteration, or adjustment of a dose specified in a treatment plan or/and administered to a patient.

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
Change, alteration, or adjustment of a dose specified in a treatment plan or/and administered to a patient.

Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.:The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A partial or complete loss of hearing in one or both ears. It is classified as conductive, sensory, or central.

Concepts.definition: A partial or complete loss of hearing in one or both ears. It is classified as conductive, sensory, or central.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A recombinant therapeutic agent chemically identical to endogenous human GM-CSF except a leucine substitution in position 23.  Binding to specific cell surface receptors, sargramostim modulates the proliferation and differentiation of a variety of hematopoietic progenitor cells with some specificity towards stimulation of leukocyte production and may reverse treatment-induced neutropenias. This agent also promotes antigen presentation, up-regulates antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (ADCC), and increases interleukin-2-mediated lymphokine-activated killer cell function; it may also augment host antitumoral immunity.: A response generated by a stimulus.

Concepts.definition: A recombinant therapeutic agent chemically identical to endogenous human GM-CSF except a leucine substitution in position 23.  Binding to specific cell surface receptors, sargramostim modulates the proliferation and differentiation of a variety of hematopoietic progenitor cells with some specificity towards stimulation of leukocyte production and may reverse treatment-induced neutropenias. This agent also promotes antigen presentation, up-regulates antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (ADCC), and increases interleukin-2-mediated lymphokine-activated killer cell function; it may also augment host antitumoral immunity.
A response generated by a stimulus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group of neurologic disorders caused by damage to the nervous system following exposure to pharmacologic, biologic, and chemical agents. Examples of neurotoxins include chemotherapy agents, radiation treatment, heavy metals, pesticides, and food additives.

Concepts.definition: A group of neurologic disorders caused by damage to the nervous system following exposure to pharmacologic, biologic, and chemical agents. Examples of neurotoxins include chemotherapy agents, radiation treatment, heavy metals, pesticides, and food additives.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Delayed-type hypersensitivity reaction to foreign proteins derived from an animal serum. It occurs approximately six to twenty one days following the administration of the foreign antigen. Symptoms include fever, arthralgias, myalgias, skin eruptions, lymphadenopathy, chest pain, and dyspnea. Certain drugs (e.g., antibiotics, anticancer agents, and anti-inflammatory medications) and infectious disorders (e.g., hepatitis B) may also cause serum sickness-like reaction.

Concepts.definition: Delayed-type hypersensitivity reaction to foreign proteins derived from an animal serum. It occurs approximately six to twenty one days following the administration of the foreign antigen. Symptoms include fever, arthralgias, myalgias, skin eruptions, lymphadenopathy, chest pain, and dyspnea. Certain drugs (e.g., antibiotics, anticancer agents, and anti-inflammatory medications) and infectious disorders (e.g., hepatitis B) may also cause serum sickness-like reaction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to or using sight; able to be seen.: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or using sight; able to be seen.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lower than normal levels of sodium in the circulating blood.

Concepts.definition: Lower than normal levels of sodium in the circulating blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An acute or chronic condition that is characterized by the inability of the kidneys to adequately filter the blood.: A laboratory test result demonstrating an increased concentration of creatinine in a biological specimen.

Concepts.definition: An acute or chronic condition that is characterized by the inability of the kidneys to adequately filter the blood.
A laboratory test result demonstrating an increased concentration of creatinine in a biological specimen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A syndrome characterized by leakage of intravascular fluids into the extravascular space. This syndrome is observed in patients who demonstrate a state of generalized leaky capillaries following shock syndromes, low-flow states, ischemia-reperfusion injuries, toxemias, medications, or poisoning. It can lead to generalized edema and multiple organ failure.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome characterized by leakage of intravascular fluids into the extravascular space. This syndrome is observed in patients who demonstrate a state of generalized leaky capillaries following shock syndromes, low-flow states, ischemia-reperfusion injuries, toxemias, medications, or poisoning. It can lead to generalized edema and multiple organ failure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Blood pressure that is abnormally low.

Concepts.definition: Blood pressure that is abnormally low.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

Concepts.definition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Allergic Reaction Infusion Procedure Reaction Anaphylaxis

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Allergic Reaction Infusion Procedure Reaction Anaphylaxis
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An immune response that occurs following re-exposure to an innocuous antigen, and that requires the presence of existing antibodies against that antigen. This response involves the binding of IgE to mast cells, and may worsen with repeated exposures.: Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.: A response generated by a stimulus.: An acute hypersensitive immune response that occurs from exposure to an allergen. It results from the release of histamine and histamine-like substances from mast cells, and can present with breathing difficulty due to narrowed airways, dizziness and hypotension, skin rash, weak pulse, nausea and vomiting.

Concepts.definition: An immune response that occurs following re-exposure to an innocuous antigen, and that requires the presence of existing antibodies against that antigen. This response involves the binding of IgE to mast cells, and may worsen with repeated exposures.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
A response generated by a stimulus.

An acute hypersensitive immune response that occurs from exposure to an allergen. It results from the release of histamine and histamine-like substances from mast cells, and can present with breathing difficulty due to narrowed airways, dizziness and hypotension, skin rash, weak pulse, nausea and vomiting.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept to value meaning. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition resulting from the excessive loss of water from the body. It is usually caused by severe diarrhea, vomiting or diaphoresis.

Concepts.definition: A condition resulting from the excessive loss of water from the body. It is usually caused by severe diarrhea, vomiting or diaphoresis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Forceful ejection of the contents of the stomach through the mouth.

Concepts.definition: Forceful ejection of the contents of the stomach through the mouth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Upper abdominal discomfort associated with an urge to vomit.

Concepts.definition: Upper abdominal discomfort associated with an urge to vomit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Atypical results found on serum liver enzyme testing, which may indicate significant disease and/or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: Atypical results found on serum liver enzyme testing, which may indicate significant disease and/or disease progression.
Watery bowel movements.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The invasion of an organism's body tissues by disease-causing agents and their multiplication, as well as the reaction by the host to these organisms and/or toxins that the organisms produce.

Concepts.definition: The invasion of an organism's body tissues by disease-causing agents and their multiplication, as well as the reaction by the host to these organisms and/or toxins that the organisms produce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to the kidney.: Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the kidney.
Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
